comment: Play cards to move the spaces on said card, try to keep as many tokens on the board as you can in as big a blob as you can.
Pretty boring, doesn't really grab me. Meh.
It has its moments but card draw can be painful.
The game is OK. Nothing flashy or interesting, but I can't really knock it for a negative game experience. Just feels bland and unmemorable.

I was hoping this would be one of those chess like games for people who don't like chess, but it is just the former. Pitty, as I adore most of Kosmos 2 player line. That said, If you like chess, this would probably be much higher for you.
Plats mais rapide. Pas immonde mais pas passionant.
I can appreciate some degree of randomness in an otherwise abstract game like this, but in this case I feel that there’s too much luck as the game progresses and your choices become more constrained.
Pleasant tactical two-player affair. Two copied Traded.
A fun two player confrontation game.

A superb couples game, with the ideal balance between snappy turns and slowing down to think things through. This is one we'll be playing for a while to come.

Update: Wow, the older version of this is gorgeous! The wooden tokens are one thing, and I can understand why cardboard might be cheaper, but why in the world would you replace all the hand-drawn illustrations with cheap-looking 3D renders?? Every illustration in this edition is more appealing and fully thought through. Why would you do this hard of an own-goal, Kosmos?
